datafield.subfield: Diplomat, jurist, lawyer, and United States representative from Maine. Correspondence, speeches and writings, notes, photographs, printed matter, and miscellaneous material largely concerning Hawaiian economic and political conditions, sugar plantations and trade, Chinese labor, the Hawaiian supreme court, of which Allen was chief justice, and the United States-Hawaiian Reciprocity Treaty of 1876.

titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Manuscript Division Staff

profiledesc.creation:
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division,
2010

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Diplomat, jurist, lawyer, and United States representative from Maine. Correspondence, speeches and writings, notes, photographs, printed matter, and miscellaneous material largely concerning Hawaiian economic and political conditions, sugar plantations and trade, Chinese labor, the Hawaiian supreme court, of which Allen was chief justice, and the United States-Hawaiian Reciprocity Treaty of 1876.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Elisha Hunt Allen, diplomat, jurist, lawyer, and United States representative from Maine, were given to the Library of Congress by Mary Jane Allen and Frederick Allen in 1935.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of Elisha Hunt Allen were arranged and described in 1963. The finding aid was revised in 2010.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of Elisha Hunt Allen is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Elisha Hunt Allen are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Elisha Hunt Allen Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Member, United States House of Representatives from Maine
Minister of finance, Kingdom of Hawaii
Chancellor and Chief Justice of the Kingdom of Hawaii Supreme Court
Negotiated the United States-Hawaii Reciprocity Treaty

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Elisha Hunt Allen (1804-1883) span the years 1849-1934, with the bulk of the material dating from 1867 to 1882. The papers consist of correspondence, speeches and writings, notes, awards and diplomas, invitations, passports, photographs, statistical tables, printed matter, and miscellaneous items and are organized into the following series: Family Correspondence, General Correspondence, Hawaiian Legation Correspondence, Subject File, Miscellany, and Oversize.

The Family Correspondence contains letters from Allen to his second wife, Mary Hobbs Allen, and a few letters to other members of the Allen family. Correspondents in the General Correspondence include Charles Reed Bishop, W. L. Green, Charles Coffin Harris, Henry W. Severance, and Andrew Welch. The Hawaiian Legation Correspondence contains drafts and a letterbook of official letters sent from the Hawaiian Legation. Subjects of interest covered in the several correspondence series as well as in the Subject File and Miscellany include the United States-Hawaiian Reciprocity Treaty of 1876, the Hawaiian supreme court, sugar plantations and trade, Chinese labor, and Hawaiian economic and political conditions from 1850 to 1882.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in six series:

scopecontent.p: Letters from Allen to family members including his second wife, Mary Hobbs Allen.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of family member.
Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received and letterbook.

did.unittitle: Letters received on death of Allen, 1883

scopecontent.p: Treaties, trade records, and miscellaneous items.
Invitations, passports, photographs, speeches and writings, statistical tables, and printed matter.

arrangement.p: Arranged and described according to the series, containers, and folders from which the items were removed.
